Detail: / Division: mysql> SELECT 3/5; -> 0.60 Division by zero produces a NULL result: mysql> SELECT 102/(1-1); -> NULL A division is calculated with BIGINT arithmetic only if performed in a context where its result is converted to an integer.

* Multiplication: mysql> SELECT 3*5; -> 15 mysql> SELECT 18014398509481984*18014398509481984.0; -> 324518553658426726783156020576256.0 mysql> SELECT 18014398509481984*18014398509481984; -> out-of-range error The last expression produces an error because the result of the integer multiplication exceeds the 64-bit range of BIGINT calculations. (See Section 13.1, “Numeric Data Types” .)
